summary: Post-game interview with Aaron Judge discussing his performance, challenges, and experiences during the game.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a press conference with a man wearing a black New York Yankees hoodie and cap, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees logo and Toyota branding. He is seen adjusting his cap and speaking into a microphone. Throughout the video, various tweets appear on the screen, congratulating him on his achievement of hitting 62 home runs, which is highlighted as a record-breaking feat. The tweets include messages from fans expressing their excitement and admiration for his accomplishment. The man appears to be responding to questions, with his expressions and gestures indicating engagement and pride in his achievement. The atmosphere is celebratory, with the backdrop and on-screen text emphasizing the significance of his milestone in baseball history.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker addressing a previous baseball game and his personal performance within it. He expresses frustration, citing, "wasn't helping the team out," and dissatisfaction with his at-bats and inability to get on base as the lead-off hitter. He notes how the Rangers aggressively attacked him and concludes that he wasn't putting good swings on it, reflecting on his role as a table-setter, he ends by mentioning the next day.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees hoodie and cap, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees logo and Toyota branding. He is speaking into a microphone, likely at a press conference. Throughout the video, various tweets appear on the screen, congratulating Aaron Judge for his remarkable achievement of hitting 62 home runs in a season, setting a new record in the American League. The tweets are from different users, including @PAULONEILLYES, @DAVEWINFELDHOF, and @FERGIEAJENKINS, each expressing their admiration and congratulations. The man's expressions range from focused to smiling, indicating his engagement and pride in the accomplishment. The setting is professional, with the backdrop and logos suggesting a formal sports-related event. The video captures the celebratory atmosphere surrounding Judge's historic achievement in baseball.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker expressing his hope to play in an upcoming game, mentioning, "we got one more game" and the desire to be involved. He speaks casually, then shifts to discussing an opposing pitcher, José Kinoo, whom he knows has a "nasty sinker and nasty slider". He describes his reaction to the pitcher's game two start, suggesting it was a favorable matchup and indicating that it helped him relax. He explains he went up to bat and decided to see what would happen.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a press conference with a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and hoodie, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees logo and Toyota branding. Throughout the video, various Twitter congratulatory messages appear on the screen, celebrating the individual's achievement of 62 strikeouts in a season. The messages include tweets from users such as @FERGIEAJENKINS, @RYANHOWARD, @DOCGOODEN16, and @CAMERONMAYBIN, each expressing congratulations and admiration for the accomplishment. The man appears to be speaking into a microphone, likely addressing the media or answering questions. The atmosphere is celebratory, with the backdrop and Twitter messages emphasizing the significance of the milestone. The video concludes with a promotional message for a Nets Preseason Heat vs. Nets game, scheduled for Thursday at 7:30 pm.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing his performance and interactions with fans, noting the fans' supportive presence at games, and recalling a moment where he was "booed for a single." He mentions enjoying sharing the experience with the fans, emphasizing that's "what it's about" for him. Following this, a female voice asks a question about retrieving a ball. The male speaker then replies.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated at a press conference table. He is speaking into a microphone, with a backdrop displaying the New York Yankees and Toyota logos. The man's facial expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in a conversation or answering questions. On-screen text includes Twitter handles "@CAMERONMAYBIN" and "@THEJUDGE44" with the hashtag "#YANKEES" and "#ALLRISE," indicating a social media interaction. The text "Premiere! BROOKLYN NETS SEASON PREVIEW Thursday 7:00pm" appears at the bottom, promoting an upcoming event. The atmosphere is professional, with the man appearing focused and attentive. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the man continuing to speak and occasionally looking to his side, possibly addressing someone off-camera. The Twitter handle "@YOGIBERRAMUSEUM" appears in one frame, congratulating "@THEJUDGE44" with the same hashtags, further emphasizing the social media engagement. The bottom text changes to "NYCFC on YES! ATLANTA UNITED vs. NYCFC Decision Day coverage starts Sunday 2:00pm on YES," indicating a shift in the promotional content. The video captures the man's interaction at the press conference, highlighting his engagement with the audience and the promotional elements displayed on-screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing a missing object, stating he doesn't know where it is, but hopes to get it back. He concedes it is a souvenir for the fans, and acknowledges that someone made a great catch. Another male speaker then utters the word "Yelling."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a press conference with a person wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees and Toyota logos. The individual is speaking into a microphone, with their facial expressions and gestures indicating engagement in the conversation. Throughout the video, various Twitter messages appear on the screen, congratulating Aaron Judge on his achievement. The messages include "@YOGIBERRAMUSEUM 62. CONGRATS @THEJUDGE44! #YANKEES #ALLRISE," "@NYKNICKS SHOUT OUT AARON JUDGE," and "@GIANTS ALL RISE! CONGRATS AARON JUDGE ON MAKING HISTORY." The bottom of the screen displays a ticker with sports-related information, including "NYCFC ON YES! ATLANTA UNITED vs. NYCFC Decision Day coverage starts Sunday 2:00pm on YES" and "LIVE ON THE LINE Weekdays at 12:00pm on YES." The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, focusing on the individual's interaction with the audience and the celebration of Aaron Judge's accomplishment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker being asked if he felt stress or pressure during the game, to which he replies, "You know, it's tough to say." He continues by noting that every game is stressful. The clip ends abruptly, before any further remarks.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a press conference with a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the team's logo. He is seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the New York Yankees and Toyota logos. Throughout the video, various Twitter messages appear on the screen, congratulating Aaron Judge on his historic achievement of setting an American League single-season home run record with 62, surpassing Roger Maris' previous record of 61. The messages include phrases like "ALL RISE! CONGRATS AARON JUDGE ON MAKING HISTORY," "THAT'S THE ONE! #ALLRISE FOR A LEGEND," and "HISTORY. CONGRATS ON 62, @THEJUDGE44!!" The man appears to be speaking, likely addressing the press about his accomplishment. The atmosphere is celebratory, with the focus on Judge's remarkable achievement in baseball.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker with a reflective tone, discussing feeling bad for his teammates and fans when he felt he wasn't performing well. He mentions his teammates being "stacked up" and waiting, and expresses disappointment in his performance, such as not achieving a "two for four game". The overall soundscape is relatively clean with little to no discernible background noise, putting the focus on the speaker's emotional recount.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated at a press conference table. He is speaking into a microphone, with a backdrop displaying the New York Yankees and Toyota logos. On-screen text from Brooklyn Nets congratulates him on making history, mentioning a Twitter handle. The man appears to be responding to questions, occasionally looking to his left and right, and gesturing with his hands. The atmosphere is formal, with the press conference setting emphasizing the significance of the event. The text at the bottom of the screen provides additional information about upcoming coverage and a prize pool promotion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker describing how he manages pressure, saying he tries to enjoy every moment and not focus on expectations. He mentions trying to think that the audience is there to see an exciting ballgame, which helps him stay calm, although he acknowledges there is some pressure. He concludes by saying he tries to block it out. The male speaker has a conversational, calm speaking style. A second male speaker prompts to take a couple more questions, and the first male speaker continues, referencing a previous conversation about "team stuff."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees and Toyota logos. He is speaking into a microphone, likely addressing a press conference or interview. Throughout the video, various Twitter messages appear on the screen, congratulating him on his achievement of hitting 62 home runs, a record for the MLB American League. The messages come from different Twitter users, including @NCAABaseball, @REALERMONROE, @RYANRUOCCO, and @FRESNOSTATESBSB, each expressing their congratulations and admiration for his accomplishment. The man appears to be responding to these messages, possibly discussing his record-breaking season. The video maintains a consistent setting, with the backdrop and the man's attire remaining unchanged, emphasizing the celebratory nature of the event.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker referring to the subject's teammates and other baseball players who are excited and tweeting about something. He emphasizes the excitement of "higher name players" and "marquee players," then asks how the subject feels about that. The subject, another male, responds that it's an incredible honor, particularly "compliments from your peers." He speaks with sincerity, noting that those "grinding just like you are" know how hard the game is. He continues saying, "there's no higher honor in my book," and reiterates the importance of teammates and peers. He concludes by saying it gives him chills to get respect back. The first male speaker then says, "Take the last three right here."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a post-game press conference with a New York Yankees player, dressed in a black hoodie and cap, seated at a table with the Yankees logo and Toyota branding in the background. The player, who has black eye paint under his eyes, is seen wiping his face with his hand, adjusting his cap, and looking down at the table, indicating a reflective or emotional moment. Throughout the video, various tweets appear on the screen, congratulating the player on his performance, with messages like "RECORD BREAKER," "CONGRATS @THEJUDGE44!!!" and "JUST WITNESSED HISTORY!!!! BLESSED!!!! MR. JUDGE IS INSANE!!!" These tweets highlight the player's significant achievement in the game. The MLB scoreboard at the bottom of the screen shows the Yankees leading the Texas Rangers 5-4, with the final score and player statistics displayed. The atmosphere is one of celebration and acknowledgment of the player's remarkable performance.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker questioning a second male speaker, "As your number was growing higher and higher and you kept saying, numbers don't matter, I'm worried about the winds. Was there a time, maybe home or some point, you just said to yourself, wow, this is, I could do this. Was there a moment?" The second male speaker hesitates, then responds reflectively, "Well, I think going into the every year, you know, every season, you write down goals, you have, you know, stuff you want to accomplish, you know, so um every year I think I can you know, go out there and hit 70 homers or you know, have the confidence and faith to go out there and try to do something special for the team." The speaker continues with a subdued tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a post-game press conference with a New York Yankees player, dressed in a black hoodie and cap with the Yankees logo, seated at a table with a microphone in front of him. The backdrop is adorned with the Yankees logo and Toyota branding. Throughout the video, various congratulatory tweets appear on the screen, including one from Bill Clinton (@BILLCLINTON) congratulating the player on his 62nd home run and another from President Joe Biden (@POTUS) congratulating him on the historic achievement. The scoreboard at the bottom of the screen shows the Yankees trailing the Texas Rangers 2-3 in the final game of the series. The player is seen speaking and gesturing with his hands, occasionally looking to his left and right, likely addressing questions from the press. The atmosphere is celebratory, with the player acknowledging the significance of his accomplishment. The video captures the player's reactions and interactions during the press conference, highlighting the importance of his achievement in the context of the game and the broader baseball community.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing the enjoyment of the daily grind and process of baseball, focusing on elements like "working at bat," "getting a base hit," and dealing with tough days at the plate. He emphasizes the need to wake up and show up despite setbacks. The speaker's tone is reflective and positive, highlighting his fondness for the daily routine.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated at a press conference table. He is surrounded by a backdrop featuring the New York Yankees logo and Toyota branding. Throughout the video, various tweets appear on the screen, congratulating the man, identified as "The Judge," for his achievement of hitting 62 home runs, a new American League single-season record. The tweets come from notable figures such as President Joe Biden, Governor Kathy Hochul, New York City Mayor, and Dickie V. The man appears to be responding to questions, occasionally looking to his left and right, and gesturing with his hands. The atmosphere is celebratory, with the man expressing gratitude and acknowledging the congratulations. The video captures the man's reactions and interactions during the press conference, highlighting the significance of his accomplishment in baseball history.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip seems to feature one male speaker in a casual tone, likely in a post-game interview setting, discussing his hit. He explains that while he "had a good feeling off the bat," he wasn't sure where it would land. The speaker expresses relief at seeing the ball land in a fan's glove, describing it as an opportunity for a teammate to break records. There is background speech that sounds like a sports interview setting, implying the presence of an interviewer.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the Yankees logo, seated in front of a backdrop adorned with the Yankees and Toyota logos. He is speaking into a microphone, likely at a press conference, and appears to be discussing a significant baseball achievement. Throughout the video, various tweets are displayed on the screen, including one from @DICKIEV expressing amazement at the Yankees' record-breaking home runs and another congratulatory tweet from @REALEALMONROE to @THEJUDGE44. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in a conversation, possibly responding to questions or sharing insights about the achievement. The atmosphere is professional, with the focus on the man and the backdrop emphasizing the context of the New York Yankees baseball team. The video captures the man's reactions and the celebratory nature of the achievement, as indicated by the congratulatory tweets and the man's expressions.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker, reflecting on his recent performance. He describes his thoughts during his stroll on the bases, mentioning his wife, family, teammates, and fans, emphasizing the support he's received and looking forward to getting back on defense and watching his teammate break a record, with various emotions running through his mind. The speaker’s tone is calm and reflective. Finally, another male voice interjects to say his name.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black New York Yankees cap and a black hoodie with the team's logo, seated at a press conference table. The backdrop is adorned with the New York Yankees and Toyota logos, indicating a professional sports setting. The man appears to be addressing the media, as suggested by his gestures and facial expressions. Throughout the video, text overlays provide context, mentioning statistics such as "62 home runs this season" and highlighting the achievements of players like Aaron Judge and Gerrit Cole. The atmosphere is formal and focused, typical of a sports press conference, with the man's attire and the branded backdrop reinforcing the New York Yankees' identity.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker who is being interviewed. He describes the significance of his performance, saying "not yet" and referring to his work as "just another day." His tone is conversational and slightly subdued. He notes he would've preferred if the team had won the game. He suggests he will take time to "soak it in" with his family. He anticipates it will be later when he can fully process the event's historical significance, as his main goal and focus is still the team's performance.
